info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 10:47PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN FRANKLIN... NORTHWESTERN HART AND SOUTHERN OCONEE COUNTIES THROUGH 1115 PM EDT... At 1047 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northwest of Hartwell, or near Bowersville. This storm was drifting slowly north. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lavonia, Gumlog, Canon, Bowersville, Tugaloo State Park, Martin, Reed Creek, and Fair Play. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
